content.description: Start on the left side of the large block/buttress. Climb bad rock for 20 feet, and place a #4 and move into the corner on wide moves and stems. Climb the stack of rocks on easy moves and wide gear to the top. This is a surprisingly fun route, and the rock is solid enough.
content.location: This is just left of the large block buttress and left of the Texas Boulder when approaching from the road.

content.description: Climb the shallow corner up to the ledge. Finish with perfect hands for 15 feet.
content.location: From the road, this is just right of the large boulder. It is climber's right of a prominent block in the cliff band.

content.description:
This is now separate from

H Mart 1

. Start in the OW/squeeze chimney, and climb to the ledge. From the ledge, stay left, and climb fist jams down to fingers (20 feet) to anchors.

It has a good range of moves, and though the rock higher up is very sandy, it's some of the best quality on this cliff.
content.location: This is right of Texas Boulder and in a clear corner with double cracks about 15 feet apart.

content.description:
The original line zig zags to the anchor and started the same as

Let's Go Brandon

. I realized after that there are two individual lines here. H Mart 1 now starts about 10 feet lower and to the right. Climb tricky OW and wide moves, and mantel onto the shelf (the crux). Once on the shelf, finish on easy OW moves to the anchors.
content.location:
It is 50 feet Left of the

Bull Durham

boulder.

content.description:
Climb hands to a double crack with a roof. Continue on easier climbing to the anchors.

This is a fun slab/face route that can also be TR'd off of the anchor.
content.location:
This is just left of the

Bull Snake

corner and behind the boulder.

content.description: Start on perfect hands, quickly move into a pod, and continue on OW moves to a ledge. Climb another 20 feet on a wide crack that closes down to 0.75 at the top.
content.location: This is left of Texas Boulder as you approach. Currently it is in the leftmost grouping of routes.

content.description: Climb a mostly #4 size OW on great rock. There are a few holds that you can cheat with on this one, but it is still solid 5.10.
content.location: It is in the corner to the right of the large boulder.

content.description: Climb fist to offwidth and squeeze. The hardest moves are getting off the ground and into the crack.
content.location: This is just to the climber's left of the large boulder.

content.description: Climb the band of bad rock, and pull the roof on slightly better rock. Jam perfect hands into a pod and up through the squeeze chimney.
content.location:
This route is just around the corner and to the right of

Bull Snake

.
